physical_appearance: This is a black-and-white photograph. It features a section of a tower of silence, with several tall trees peeking above the structure, and birds flying in and amongst the tree canopies. The rounded edge of the tower can be seen on the bottom of the photograph, with a doorway in the foreground. There is an inscription in the top-right of the photoraph. The photograph is slightly stained on the top-left corner.
sgcool_label_text: A variety of portraits of British soldiers that show them at leisure as well as two photographs of James Steele placing a wreath at a remembrance ceremony, this collection is part of the archive of James Steele, Royal Artillery (Field) who served in Malaya from January 1941-February 1942, when interned as a P.O.W at Changi until his release in October 1945.
title_text: Group of 50 photographs of P.O.W James Steele and regiment when stationed in Malaysia in 1941 (and 2 later photographs of Steele placing a wreath at ceremony of remembrance)  Not a nice place to spend the night, Bombay 1941 Parsee Tower of Silence, Bombay
subject_terms_1: world wars towers of silence Zoroastrianism
subject_terms_2: World War, 1939-1945 Parsees Dokhmas Zoroastrianism Photography
context_7: Great Britain. Army. Royal Field Artillery
